kw.name: Open App Minimal
kw.doc: Open app minimal

kw.name: Open application from path
kw.doc: Open application from path with apk

kw.name: Run Keyword And Ignore Error
kw.doc: Runs the given keyword with the given arguments and ignores possible error.

kw.name: Close All Applications
kw.doc: Closes all open applications.

kw.name: Run Keyword And Return Status
kw.doc: Runs the given keyword with given arguments and returns the status as a Boolean value.

kw.name: Open Application
kw.doc: Opens a new application to given Appium server. Capabilities of appium server, Android and iOS, Please check https://github.com/appium/appium/blob/master/docs/en/writing-running-appium/server-args.md | *Option* | *Man.* | *Description* | | remote_url | Yes | Appium server url | | alias | no | alias |

kw.name: No Operation
kw.doc: Does absolutely nothing.

kw.msg: WebDriverException: Message: An unknown server-side error occurred while processing the command. Original error: UiAutomator2 Server cannot start because the local port #8201 is busy. Make sure the port you provide via 'systemPort' capability is not occupied. This situation might often be a result of an inaccurate sessions management, e.g. old automation sessions on the same device must always be closed before starting new ones.

kw.name: Run Keyword And Return If
kw.doc: Runs the specified keyword and returns from the enclosing user keyword.

kw.name: Open Application
kw.doc: Opens a new application to given Appium server. Capabilities of appium server, Android and iOS, Please check https://github.com/appium/appium/blob/master/docs/en/writing-running-appium/server-args.md | *Option* | *Man.* | *Description* | | remote_url | Yes | Appium server url | | alias | no | alias |

kw.msg: Returning from the enclosing user keyword.

kw.name: Enable appium ime keyboard using adb
Execute Adb Shell
kw.doc: Execute ADB shell commands

kw.name: Execute Adb Shell
kw.doc: Execute ADB shell commands

kw.name: Wait Until Element Is Visible
kw.doc: Waits until element specified with `locator` is visible.

kw.name: Tap element when ready
kw.doc: There are 2 modes; the first one is to wait until element is ready then tap (this is a default).

kw.name: Run Keyword And Ignore Error
kw.arg: Wait until page contain element except stale
kw.doc: Runs the given keyword with the given arguments and ignores possible error.

kw.name: Convert To String
kw.doc: Converts the given item to a Unicode string.

kw.arg: Wait until element is visible except stale

kw.name: Should Not Contain
kw.doc: Fails if ``container`` contains ``item`` one or more times.

kw.name: Run Keyword And Return Status
kw.doc: Runs the given keyword with given arguments and returns the status as a Boolean value.

kw.name: Should Be Equal
kw.doc: Fails if the given objects are unequal.

kw.name: Evaluate
kw.doc: Evaluates the given expression in Python and returns the result.

kw.name: Exit For Loop If
kw.doc: Stops executing the enclosing FOR loop if the ``condition`` is true.

kw.name: Should Be True
kw.arg: msg="element either in stale mode or not visible, error message is ${err_msg}"
kw.doc: Fails if the given condition is not true.

kw.name: Convert To String
kw.doc: Converts the given item to a Unicode string.

kw.name: Set Variable
kw.doc: Returns the given values which can then be assigned to a variables.
